task.summary: Default task
Closed memory leaks in SSL certificate creation and network stream creation. Extensive clean up and dead-code stripping.
Disabled SSL certificate loading and check code as it appears not to be needed. Consolidated all places where network is torn down and removed from run loop.
Clean up: stripped dead code, stripped dead stores, reformatted some for clarity. Marked some leaks. Will fix in subsequent commits.

Implemented a singleton pattern in SecurifiToolkit. It was then simple to remove memory leaks around async queue creation. Some other clean up and rationalization of method return values. More to be done.
Clean up: fixed all compiler warnings
Clean up: fixed all compiler warnings
Clean up: fixed compiler warnings by changing signature of initReconnectSDK and cleaning up control logic for managing reconnect attempts.
Clean up: fixed compiler warnings and other problems
Updated MPProgressHUD to latest, v.0.8, which brings iOS 7 compatability and bug fixes.
Clean up: stripped dead imports and code
The controller was leaking HUD views each time it was shown. Lots of code clean up and some other fixes. More clean up and refactoring needed.
Clean up: reformat and other syntax modernizations in prep for bug fixing. There's a nice leak in this controller's management of subviews. Will track down next...
Clean up: strip dead code and other fix-ups as part of leak investigation.
Fixed a bad leak in the way table view cells were being managed. App now runs closer to a steady state.
Refactored and clean up. Removed unused properties Rationalized the way the current list of Almonds is loaded, and removed double loading that was occurring on instantiation of the controller.
Minor clean up
Plugged various leaks. Code clean up.
Minor clean up
Plug a serious leak causing instantiation of a ctrl each time the parent became visible.
Fixed build settings: build all architectures for RELEASE builds
Plug leaks in dispatch_queue creation by using the system's default queue
Cleaning up Reachability in preparation of pushing it into the SDK
Pushed responsibility for reconnecting to the network into the SDK itself. UI does not initiate this process anymore.
Tracked down and closed a leak

Did significant refactoring of SingleTon and SecurifiToolkit. Connection management is more reliable, and responsibilities between classes is now demarcated. SecurifiToolkit coordinates all network set-up and tear-down. SingleTon is no longer a singleton.
Some clean up
Some clean up
Use SDK's async methods for sending commands. Fixed a problem with the HUD always showing up. Clean up.
Removed hard coded test logon credentials.
Introducing new methods for submitting commands to the SDK.
Updated for changes in SDK governing how commands are submitted to the cloud. In UI, many submissions blocked the main thread. Now, submissions are asynchronous and return immediately.
fixed compiler warning by changing app icon to 80x80 dimensions.
Passing underlying socket to the underlying routine that sends commands. Logging payload string, not bytes, is easier for debugging.
Continuing to refine process for managing socket's lifecycle. Introduced a delegate protocol allowing the SDK to be informed of changes.
Extensive changes: begininning process to encapsualte key functionality inside the SDK, including credentials. Removed getConnectionState and replaced with higher level methods.
Consoldiated and factored out functionality for managing and responding to logon requests. More work needed.
Moved from the UI layer
Evaluate the SSL connection's trust by using the CA certificate root.
Moving the "database" functionality into the SDK
Set kCFStreamSSLValidatesCertificateChain to YES. Some logging improvements.
Clean up
Clean up: strip dead code; some logging improvements.
Pushed all responsibility for storing email, pass token, and account ID into the SDK. This information is now stored securely in the app's keychain.
Clean up

Introduced a dispatch_semaphore that allows clients to wait on for connection establishment. This will allow us to remove the infinite while loop in the SecurifiToolkit serving the same purpose (but without guarantee of exiting).

Syncing behavior with Android: remove retry thread. Reconnect on demand. Other clean up and improvements. We now wait on a dispatch_semaphore provided by the SingleTon when first establishing the network connection.
Surpress logging
Make Logout All work. Various functional clean up and polish.
Push responsibility for presenting and managing Logout and Logout All into the main controller.
Push responsibility for presenting and managing Logout and Logout All into the main controller.
Disabled landscape mode for entire app. Don't have time for this release to sort out all problems with that orientation.
Clean up
Push notifications from the network onto their own queue. Fixed concurrency bug in shutdown process causing a retain cycle; do it synchronously instead.
Add a connection retry process to the Main View
Make sure table reloading is done on the main thread

Started refactoring and clean up. Fixed problem with dynamic sensor value updates causing update not to be shown in UI. Fixed a number of problems with table view cell management. Removed and reduced stored and shared state; there is much more to be done. Added cell animation on reload---it looks better.
Added "STATE" constant
Added "STATE" constant
Removed IBOUTLET reference to sensors table.
Fine tune the cell animations, and make sure distinct cells for each size is created.
Set icon tinit colors to black per style guidelines
Resolved layout metric conflict in login controller "email" field
Clena up and further rationalization: on successful login, the controller no longer attempts to load Almond data and allows its delegate to do this instead.
Set icon tinit colors to black per style guidelines
Clean up and further rationalization: the controller was intercepting and responding to events it should have allowed its children to handle.
Clean up. Re-did table cell creation/mgt.
When the cloud is offline, display a message and do not show the router list.
Added connection status icons to the top nav bar for Sensors and Routers
On going refactoring. Consolidate UISlider and UISegmentControl callback code. Other clean up and consolidation. Lots more to do.
Button that sets its background to indicate press down
Integrated new icons
Prototyping some ideas for adding behaviors to value holders
Reworking the layout esp. for 3.5 inch screens, and making the sign-up process work. More work to be done.
Don't bring up the keyboard immediately on preseninting the view, because it obscures the Sign Up button. Other minor clean up.
Rationalize process for enabling Continue button
Fixing some keyboard event handling problems.
Polishing the sign-up experience
Added a formal "shutdown" method. On termination, the app now shutsdown the SDK.
The "wait on connection establishment" semaphore was using a groslly low wait time. On older hardware this might have been causing problems.
Keychains perist after the app is deleted from a device. So, we keep track whether the app is a fresh install and force the user to re-login.
Removed dead code
Minor clean up
UI polish and clean up
UI Polish
Only enable the Lost Password button when an email address is specified.
Set tint color to black or green, depending on connection state.
Minor clean up
SDK now posts a "network connecting" event, and the UI shows a "connecting" status icon.
Moved notification set up into view loading.
Consolidated and transformed #define int values for representing connection state into an enum.
Added method to SDK allowing client to determine whether network is in "connecting" state
Push truth for network connection state into the SDK and consolidate logic for setting status icon in UI
Introduced a timeout on waiting for connection establishment. Encapsulated the socket's output and input streams by moving "write command" method into the SingleTon itself.
Reset current changed name and location buffer when expanding a tile for editing
Various fixed and polish. Disable the login button while logging in.
Wait for network bring up is completed before dispatching the command
Added actual Terms of Use and License
Encapsulate and layer the Logout All notification mechanism
Fixed some layout problems in LogoutAll view
Fixed some layout problems in LogoutAll view
Polishing the UI
Fixed layout problem in DrawerViewController. Converted it to a UITableViewController and removed corresponding storyboard---not needed for a basic view like this.
Fixed layout problem in DrawerViewController. Converted it to a UITableViewController and removed corresponding storyboard---not needed for a basic view like this.
Pushed management of "Current Almond" into the SDK
Introduced DEBUG logging mode. Added DEBUG=0 to Release build settings
Converted many NSLog to DLog
Pushed management of "Current Almond" into the SDK
Pushed management of "Current Almond" into the SDK
Added armor plating to prevent "index out of bounds" crashes especially when frequent dynamic updates are going on
Encapsulating routines into the database manager. Converted DatabaseUpdateService into a singleton instance. The SDK was not actually starting up the update service, so this is fixed now.
Encapsulated all handling of Dynamic updates into the SDK
Added support for Almond name pdates and changes to the Almond list
Refined Current Almond selection on handling of dynamic updates
Logout now succeeds even when the network is down. Pushed logout notification into the SDK, which can then handle it before notifying the UI layer.
Pushing Login Response handling into the SDK, which then notifies the UI.
Be sure logon credentials are cleared prior to processing logon
clean up
Added debug description
Added 'copy' attribute to properties
Added debug logging statement
Minor clean up
Clean up
Introduced SUnit command wrapper that coordinates request-response loops in network layer.
Shorten the timeout when waiting on the semaphore
Minor clean up
Clean up
Clean up: reinstating the serial command queue because it provides an orderly way to manage SingleTon instances as they are torn down and replaced. Other changes.
Make sure "Fetch device list and hash" are done using the same SingleTon as was used to initialize the connection; otherwise, a feedback loop could be created causing infinite network ops.
Clean up
Added synchronization for reading and writing to the database. Probably need to revist this design later, but the focus right now is on correctness and preventing corruption.

Pulled out the data manager routines and put them into the toolkit. Changed the event handling such that the UI subscribes to an event published by the toolkit, which handles the dynamic updates, stores the results, and then notifies the UI. Before now, there were various parties in the system managing changes.
Clean up
No longer needed
No longer neededRemoved SFIDatabaseUpdateService. It is no longer needed.
Added support for managing device list and device value list changes
Reimplemented the serialization and implemented - (void)description
Added some debug logging to track updates to the devlices list and device values list
Updated for change in notification name
Various improvements to ensure changes to devices and values are coordinated on the main queue.
Added support in the SDK for requesting and responding to Almond hash values.
Refining process for deleting almonds. Other clean up.
Rationalizing and consolidating process for initializing the view and responding to changes both to the almond list and device values.
Updated per changes in SDK for setting the Current Almond
Removed direct managenemt of Almond List. This is handled by the SDK.
Clean up
Keep track of Device Hash requests per each connection context. Request Device Hashes when the current connection has been changed.
Surpress showing a HUD when changing the current Almond.
Cleaned up logging: NSLog -> DLog
New BugSense Key
Reset back to DEBUG builds
Iniitialize Bug Sense first, then the Securifi code, to ensure any crashes on start up are caught.
Router view is not responsible for setting "Current Almond"
Minor clean up
Added a separate side channel for submitting "cloud initialization" commands at network start up. They are processed before other queued commands.
Implemented 'description' for logging
Clean up: allow commands to time out while waiting for cloud initialization.
Clean up: make sure UI updates are coordinated on the main thread
Clean up
Added armour plating in the command callback handlers to protect against null pointers
Performance improvements to eliminate most waiting on semaphores.
Added more armor plating in markCloudInitialization
Clean up: on login, present the main view controller immediately---do not wait for Almond List response.
Show a HUD when the Almond List updates
Removed the green tint on the 'cloud connected' icon

Added some armour plating in the callback handlers in case the view is being released while the callback is happening. Some other clean up. We process mobile command responses for all almonds, not just the current one; need to push this into the SDK.
Minor clean up
Post a login action on dismissing keyboard. Show a HUD when logging in.
No longer serialize isPresent device value attribute. It is an ephemeral value.
Fixed some problems when processing device values for which devices are missing. In this case, we request a Hash and load new devices.
FIxed log msg
Changes wait time interval from 1 sec to 500ms
Added proper "Almond Is Offline" message on Routers tab
Adjusted semaphore waits and timeouts in order to lower latencies. Logon to first Sensor now down to 3-4 seconds.
Added support for "Alond is Down" message
Present the HUD full screen
kSFIDidUpdateAlmondList now posts the current Almond selection
onDeviceListResponse only posts a notification when the new and old device lists are different
The singleton was not calling its delegate on "shutdown"
be sure to dismiss the HUD if a logon request fails due to connection failure
Changed kSFIDidChangeDeviceList: post only when a device is added or removed
Added toast on pressing Save button. Various changes to how HUD is shown/managed. More armour plating around notification callbacks.
DEVICE_VALUE_LIST_RESPONSE was not setting the Almond MAC value, making it difficult for the SDK to process the list. Other clean up.
Clean up
Added tryRequestDeviceValueList method to manage per-connection per-almond device list requests
Clean up
Clean up
Defined a special debug logger for the network layer

Fixed bug that would cause the command queue to give up on dispatching a command. Renamed notification constants and values so that they are consistent with each other. Dynamic data is now posted on its own queue so that it does not hold up normal command processing.
Reworked some logic for handling hash responses. Added dynamic response callback queue.
signal cloud init latch for each total queued command count
Enforce max password length
clean up
Added pull to refresh
Show a spinner when the tab is shown. Added pull to refresh function.
Allow refresh actions to fire when cloud is offline
clean up
Require the user to accept or decline the terms of use before signing up.
Added memory warning logging
The main tab view is now built once and then re-used as Almonds are selected. Switched to using SWRevealViewController.
Re-use Almond list cells instead of creating distinct ones for each Almond
Plugged a serious leak in the table view cell code. Object allocation is still high and not steady state, but at least objects are being reclaimed.
Plugged a serious leak in the table view cell code. Object allocation is still high and not steady state, but at least objects are being reclaimed.
Pruned dead source files and stroyboards

The SDK now posts an event when the current Almond selection changes, and the UI listens and reacts to the change. This is the mechanism by which the selection in the Drawer view is conveyed to the sensors and router views.
Disable pan gesture recognizer for now, because it interferes with sensor sliders.
Adjusted layout on table view
Clean up
Reset state in initializeAlmondData
Clean up
Clean up
Re-added "Swipe to reveal" gesture
Re-fixed the Logout All field alignments, which must have been whacked during last edit in storyboard.
Added more protection in async callbacks to detect when the view is being dismissed.

Added more protection in async callbacks to detect when the view is being dismissed. Wrapped devices list in an accessor that will protect against "array out of bounds" errors caused when the devices list is changed out while another routine is using it.
Added back DEBUG crash reporting config
Fixed UIContraints causing layout problems in Sign Up screen. Tweeked the animations that move feeds to visible on the sign up screen, on 3.5 inch screens.

Fixed some problems when processing device list callbacks that could the system to cache stale information until the user logs out. Added some optimizations in device list request processing to prevent back-to-back requests.
Synchronize access to willFetchDeviceListFlag
Installed a gesture recognizer delegate to handle touch handling conflicts with UISliders
Installed a gesture recognizer delegate to handle touch handling conflicts with UISliders. Some cleanup in HUD management.
Removed swipe recongizer because the undrling SWReavelViewController will handle this for us.
Found root cause of UISlider performance problems: increase height of control and increase size of slider knob's effective touch region.
Changed the Sign Up flow, forcing user to accept license immediately.
Refactoring the sensors
Refactoring the sensors
Refactoring the sensors
Refactoring the sensors
tweeking the metrics
Adjusted behavior on timeout of cloud initialization process to ensure the network connection is shutdown.
show an error message when the login fails due to network connection problems. Be sure the Login button state is set from the Main queue.
Tweeking metrics
Keep the login button enabled whenever credentials are provided. Rely on HUD to prevent double tapping.
Trying to figure our source of occasional segfaults in networking: when shutting down network sockets, synchronize on the same locker used by the method that sends data through the sockets.

Redesigned the event handlers to solve login problem: hitting the Login button would cause two successive login requests to be handled and follow on results manifesting as user being logged in but without any Almonds attached.
fixed up some logging statements
cleaned up some of the latch signal handler code used during network establishment and cloud initialization phases: do not ignore timeout when network stream is connected.
Backed out changes because we re-opened 1.0 codebase
clean up
Added - (void)setBoolValue:(BOOL)value;
Encapsulating business logic
Switched to delegation model from using Responder Chain for propagating events from table cells.
Building out a replacement Sensors view controller
Clean up
Clean up
Clean up. Compute cell shading values.
clean up
Tweeking cell colors
clean up

MESSAGE.value: Synchronize access to willFetchDeviceListFlag
Installed a gesture recognizer delegate to handle touch handling conflicts with UISliders
Installed a gesture recognizer delegate to handle touch handling conflicts with UISliders. Some cleanup in HUD management.
Removed swipe recongizer because the undrling SWReavelViewController will handle this for us.
Found root cause of UISlider performance problems: increase height of control and increase size of slider knob's effective touch region.
Changed the Sign Up flow, forcing user to accept license immediately.
Refactoring the sensors
tweeking the metrics
Adjusted behavior on timeout of cloud initialization process to ensure the network connection is shutdown.
show an error message when the login fails due to network connection problems. Be sure the Login button state is set from the Main queue.
Tweeking metrics
Keep the login button enabled whenever credentials are provided. Rely on HUD to prevent double tapping.
Trying to figure our source of occasional segfaults in networking: when shutting down network sockets, synchronize on the same locker used by the method that sends data through the sockets.

Redesigned the event handlers to solve login problem: hitting the Login button would cause two successive login requests to be handled and follow on results manifesting as user being logged in but without any Almonds attached.
fixed up some logging statements
cleaned up some of the latch signal handler code used during network establishment and cloud initialization phases: do not ignore timeout when network stream is connected.
Backed out changes because we re-opened 1.0 codebase
Added - (void)setBoolValue:(BOOL)value;
Encapsulating business logic
Switched to delegation model from using Responder Chain for propagating events from table cells.
Building out a replacement Sensors view controller
Clean up
Clean up. Compute cell shading values.
Tweeking cell colors
